Theory_Analysis: Simple Case: High coherence expected between Extractive and Abstractive parts.
Medium Case: Tests how well the system handles technical terms like 'Qubits'.
Hard Case: Long specialized sentences; tests information density.
Edge Case: Very short text; tests if the system maintains stability with minimal input.
Edge Case: Input < K; tests the merger's ability to not over-extract.
Edge Case: High punctuation; tests the robustness of the Sentence Segmenter.
Hard Case: Logical contrast; tests if Pegasus captures the 'However' nuance.
Worst-Case: Heavy Redundancy; tests the Redundancy Filter (SequenceMatcher).
Worst-Case: Unrelated sentences; tests the Graph connectivity logic.
Worst-Case: Token Stress; tests the 512-token limit of the Pegasus model.
